intro: Erodium cheilanthifolium subsp. cheilanthifolium, commonly known as the flameweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its bright red or orange flowers that bloom in late summer and early fall. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces seeds in small, capsule-like structures. The species is part of the Geraniaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar floral structures.
